posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: How do use a pid loop and be able use values like ks ka kv kg, we are trying to set Setpoint for our end effector in pair with a duty cycle encoder so we need some kind of pid controller from wpi. Is there any that has more parameters than just kp ki kd?

posts.name: Chris Gerth
posts.cooked:
FeedForward requires you incorporate knowledge of the mechanism being controlled into the controller.

Here are some wpilib examples .

posts.name: Prince
posts.cooked: How would I use both feedforward and normal pid together?

posts.name: Eli Barnett
posts.cooked: You just add their outputs together.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.custom_user_title: Robot apartments! invisible suburbs! skeleton treasuries!

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked:
There is a great WPILib page on exactly what you are looking for! You take the output of both controllers and literally add them together.

Feedforward and feedback controllers can each be used in isolation, but are most effective when combined together. Thankfully, combining these two control methods is exceedingly straightforward - o...

link_counts.title: Combining Feedforward and PID Control — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked: Example of what adding looks like…

posts.name: Chris Gerth
posts.cooked:
Very literally, with a “+”

However, there is some nuance if you’re using a modern brushless motor controller (like almost every team is to some extent), and want to do PID + FeedForward.

Here’s the picture I draw for my students:

image 1444×842 14 KB

image 1444×842 14 KB

image 1444×842 14 KB

Further complexifying it, different manufactures have different ways of moving parts of the feedforward or the setpoint logic internal to the motor controller. Which will move the red line, and change the functions that one needs to call to cross the red line.

There are many possible answers unfortunately.
